item.title: Jaci add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "My mother is a fish." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Ayn Rand
Jaci add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a <i>story</i>." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of our lives." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "There's no such thing as perfect writing, just like there's no such thing as perfect despair." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The man in black fled across the desert, and the gunslinger followed." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "And I still surfed on Manhattan static." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "As for me, I'm a gurgling wizard of calorific excess." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Andrew Lang
item.description: "Young men, especially in America, write to me and ask me to recommend “a course of reading.” Distrust a course of reading! People who really care for books read all of them. There is no other course." -- Andrew Lang

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Freedom lies in being bold." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jaci add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Ideas are more difficult to kill than people, but they can be killed, in the end." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Alfred Bester
item.description: "Faith in faith' he answered himself. 'It isn't necessary to have something to believe in. It's only necessary to believe that somewhere there's something worthy of belief." -- Alfred Bester

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jaci add a quote by Simon Van Booy
item.description: "Whether you know it or not, we leave parts of ourselves wherever we go." -- Simon Van Booy
